properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 2 at 1:46PM MST until January 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WILL PERSIST THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY...

...VERY STRONG WINDS WILL CREATE GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS AROUND
ARLINGTON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...

* WHAT...Ground blizzard conditions expected. Total snow
accumulations of up to one inch. Winds increasing tonight
approaching 60 mph by early morning Friday. Gusts as high as 70
mph late Friday morning through Friday evening. Fresh snow from
the snow storm on New Years Day of 7 to 11 inches will be blown
around by these very strong winds creating white out conditions.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 from Arlington to Elk Mountain

* WHEN...From 3 AM Friday to 5 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very
strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If possible...cancel your travel plans if
traveling Interstate 80 between Rawlins and Laramie. Travel
will become impossible through this stretch of Interstate 80.
Additional Details text here or remove bullet entirely
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: GROUND BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM FRIDAY TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY
